column1: 10 delicious and hearty salads with champignons
Interesting dishes with fresh and pickled mushrooms that can be prepared for the holiday and just like that.
1. Salad with mushrooms, cilantro and lemon juice
Rinse and dry the champignons. Then peel and cut into thin slices. Chop the cilantro.
Mix lemon juice with oil. Pour them mushrooms with herbs, salt and pepper.
2. Salad with champignons and bell pepper
Boil the champignons in 7-10 minutes in salted water. Throw in a colander, rinse under running water and cool.
Cut onions into small cubes, carrots - medium, pepper - straws. Pass the garlic through the press. Chop greens.
Heat a little vegetable in a pan. In 3-5 minutes, fry the onions, toss the carrots and cook for another 4-5 minutes. Put on a plate and cool.

Put mushrooms, onions with carrots, garlic and bell pepper in a bowl. Salt, pepper, add vinegar and sugar. Stir and leave for 20-25 minutes at room temperature. Sprinkle with herbs and garnish with lemon slices before serving.
10 interesting beet salads for those who are tired of a fur coat and vinaigrette
3. Salad with mushrooms, cashews and tomatoes
180 g of dried or fresh cherry
salt and ground pepper - to taste
Cut the tomatoes into medium slices. Chop the thyme.
Pour champignons with 2 tablespoons of oil, mix and put on a baking sheet. Add thyme. Bake for about 15 minutes at 220 ¬∞ C. Remove and cool slightly.
In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. In 3-4 minutes, saute the cashews until golden brown. Put on a plate, mix with honey and sesame seeds, cool.
Combine the remaining oil with vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper. Put mushrooms, cashews, tomatoes and spinach in a deep bowl. Season the salad and mix.
4. Salad with mushrooms and Beijing cabbage
Boil hard-boiled eggs in 10 minutes, cool and chop. Cut the champignons into small pieces, onions in half rings. Peking cabbage chop. Finely chop the greens.
In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Fry the mushrooms in 7-10 minutes. Add the onions, salt, pepper and cook about the same. Put on a plate and refrigerate.
Mix cabbage with mayonnaise. Put in the molding ring mounted on the plate. Sprinkle with eggs and mushrooms with onions on top. Garnish with greens.
5. Salad with mushrooms, chicken and grapes
150 g chicken (can be replaced with ham)
Boil the chicken and eggs until tender and cool.
Cut the champignons into slices, chicken and squirrels into small cubes. Halve the grapes and remove the seeds. Mash yolks with a fork and mix with mayonnaise, milk and mustard.
In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Fry the mushrooms in 10-15 minutes.
Put mushrooms, chicken, egg whites and grapes in a bowl. Add dressing, salt, pepper and mix.
12 fruit and berry salads that are tastier than cakes
Boil the eggs until cooked and cool. Cut the cucumber and meat into strips, eggs and mushrooms - in small pieces. Grate cheese on a medium or coarse grater, chop dill.
Put the beef, mushrooms, eggs, cheese and cucumbers in a deep bowl. Season with sour cream, salt, pepper and mix. Garnish with greens on top.
7. Salad with mushrooms, rice and crab sticks
Boil the rice until cooked and cool. Hard-boiled egg in 10 minutes. Grind mushrooms, onions, crab sticks and protein. Grate cheese and yolk on a fine grater.
In a pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Fry the mushrooms with onions in 10-15 minutes. Salt a couple of minutes before being ready. After cool.

Mix crab sticks, rice, mushrooms with onions and squirrels separately with mayonnaise: add 1 teaspoon to each ingredient. Put rice in a small molding ring, followed by crab sticks, half cheese, mushrooms and squirrels. Sprinkle with yolk and cheese.
8. Salad with mushrooms, ham and cheese
100 g of processed cheese (can be replaced with semi-hard)
Boil potatoes, carrots and eggs until cooked and cool.
Cut the ham and mushrooms into small pieces. Chop the onion finely. Grate potatoes, eggs, carrots and cheese on a coarse grater.
Put the cooking ring on the plate. Lay out potatoes, onions, cheese, mushrooms, ham, carrots and eggs in layers. After each, except the last, coat with mayonnaise. Garnish with greens before serving.
9. Salad with mushrooms, cucumbers, chicken and prunes
¬º teaspoon ground black pepper or a mixture of peppers.
Boil potatoes and eggs until cooked. Cool. Cut potatoes, chicken, mushrooms, prunes and cucumbers into small pieces. Chop the eggs finely. Grate cheese on a medium grater.
For dressing, mix sour cream with olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, salt and pepper.
Place the molding ring on the plate. Lay out layers of potatoes, mushrooms mixed with cucumbers, prunes, chicken, eggs. After each layer add a dressing. Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
10 egg salads that will help out in any situation
250-300 g chicken breast fillet (can be replaced with ham)
1 small bunch of dill, parsley or green onions
Boil chicken breast, potatoes, carrots and eggs until tender and cool.
Finely chop the cucumbers, chicken and eggs. Grind greens. Grate cheese, potatoes and carrots on a coarse grater.
Cover a bowl with a narrow bottom and wide edges from the inside with cling film and leave enough more to cover the salad on top. Lightly grease the film with vegetable oil.

Put champignons on the bottom of the bowl so that the hats are on the bottom. Sprinkle with herbs, and then lay out layers of chicken, cheese, eggs, cucumbers, carrots and potatoes. Grease each one with mayonnaise. Squeeze lightly so that the layers are in close contact and level the top.
Cover with a film and leave in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours. Remove the film and cover the bowl with the salad plate. Gently flip so that the mushrooms are on top.
